item.description:
From the MOS website: On August 24, AD 79, Mount Vesuvius erupted, burying the ancient Roman city of Pompeii under volcanic ash for over 1,700 years.  The Museum of Science, Boston will explore the life and death of this thriving city in A Day in Pompeii. The 13,000-square-foot touring exhibit immerses visitors in the richness of one of the greatest archaeological treasures ever unearthed.

http://www.mos.org/visitor_info/museum_news/press_releases&d=5069

The exhibit also includes a dozen body casts made of polyester resin from the original molds of citizens and animals in their final moments. Perhaps one of the most moving casts is of a man reaching out to a woman, as they lie together.  I visited Pompeii in the 80's and was so moved to actually be there, now here's a chance to see all this in Boston.

If you want to see this incredible event, be sure to go to your local library and get your pass today. The general admission is $27.00.  With the pass, you get general admission for free and only $11 to see the exhibit.  They admit groups into the exhibit every TEN minutes.  So, let's plan on meeting in the lobby at 1:30p.  I will make reservations at La Famiglia Giorgio in the North End, located at 112 Salem Street for 4P for an early Sunday Supper.

group.name: Boston Baby Boomers Meetup Group-Social Fun

item.name: Pompeii Exhibit and Early Supper North End
